intro: Physalis pruinosa var. pruinosa, commonly known as the woolly nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family. It is native to regions of Central and South America and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into inflated, lantern-like fruits. These fruits are typically orange to red in color and contain numerous seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and is also used in some traditional herbal remedies.
